<OL=
D - Tuscon & Friends>

Tucson's expression doesn't change .  In fact it see=
med to become rather fierce as if he had a mortal enemy in front of him.  H=
is words were  being contradicted and that was one of his greatest pet peev=
es.  At any moment it seemed that he would easily thrust an angry fist clea=
r through the table but he restrains himself from doing so.  Straight Shot =
looks at Wheelie with a bit of concern.

" Ohh boy, Wheelie I think you bet=
ter not lash out at Tucson any more.  First of, he's a Prime, and we never =
contradict a prime.  Second, his bite is as bad as his bark.  Just picture =
Ratchet but a thousand times worse" .  Third, keep it up and he will send y=
ou through walls effortlessly. "

Night Shift nods in agreement. "

" Oh ye=
ah, she's got that right.  I've seen what happens when ya cross Tucson's li=
ne.  And you're just a toe length away from feel'n his fury."

Tucson turns=
 his attentions to the group. 

" I may be blind but I'm not without logic =
circuitry.  Leo Prime called this meeting to discuss matters of importance,=
 not for singling out comrades and commanders for ridicule!  Now if one mor=
e shred of ridicule is thrown out on this table, I will demand that the ind=
ividual responsible, be escorted out of this room IMMEDIATELY!  THAT IS AN =
ORDER!"

His fist goes down hard on the table, causing it to vibrate.  Rat =
Trap straightens up on his chair as he pays close attention to Tucson.

" U=
lp, yep, he's mad, really, really mad."


<NEW - Wheelie>

Wheelie was in a=
 standoff over wiht Tuscon, Tuscon seemingly ready to redn and rage about, =
Wheelie seeming to enjoy picking and baiting the larger (relatively) and bu=
lkier Autobot.

Wheelie catcalled over at Tuscon, "Talking about how angry =
you are.  Why not drive off and show off that car?  That's all you seem to =
be, talk talk talk, saying how you're so scary!  Well, where I come from, p=
eople do and don't say!  Those who say don't do, and they just all play!"

=
And then over from the front of the room as pandemonium seemed to be ready =
to break out, as Windlord left, and Leo PRime tried to get control, one of =
the few mechanoids that Wheelie respected to a degree, RODIMUS PRIME, spoke=
 up.  And Wheelie then lowered his weapon, "As you ask, I shall do.  But I =
do it for him, not for you."  Glancing over at Tuscon.

Then, at the commen=
ts from Night Shift and Straight Shot, Wheelie was egged on again, "I would=
 say get bent, since you already seem to be, it's nothing new, just between=
 you and me."  And then at the tossing out of Ratchet, "You say that name l=
ike it should make sense.  He's here in a sleep, so don't be dense." Meanin=
g the Ark, "By the time I was around, he was dead, word to the wise.  So th=
reatening me with the name of someone passed along makes you silly, ineffec=
tive guys."

Wheelie going on, then retreating into the back, "You want som=
eone mad, you want someone angry, I'll give you Slag, for whom his name is =
a cuss word thrown out like candy!  He's not a very happy guy, and I see no=
thing for why Ratchet should be brought up, oh my."

Then going over to tak=
e a seat in the corner, Wheelie glancing up at Leo PRime, and finally softe=
ning, "I guess I owe you an apology. I'm sorry.  With the cast of glitches =
on Earth, you have a cue to worry.  Looks like you've got your work cut out=
, if you're going to stay about."
